c: Concept Building And Discussion 2 金5サラングル
e: サラングル マエリース

n.c: Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two discussion tests during the semester: one in the first half related to group projects and another in the second half related to individual projects. Each test is worth 10%.

Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete two written reports (each worth 15%) based on in-class discussions and presentations: one for the group project and another for the individual project.

Evaluation Details: Twice during the semester, students will need to make oral presentations of findings obtained first through a group research project and then through an individual research project. Each presentation is worth 20% of the final grade. In addition, students will regularly be evaluated on their contributions to discussion and problem-solving tasks assigned in class. This component is worth 10% of the final grade.

Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation  Attendance Policy Students must attend at least two-thirds of the sessions, or they will receive an ‘F' for their final grade.  Homework and Participation Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, collecting experimental data, and preparing presentations.

n.c: Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two discussion tests during the semester: one in the first half related to group projects and another in the second half related to individual projects. Each test is worth 10%.

Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete two written reports (each worth 15%) based on in-class discussions and presentations: one for the group project and another for the individual project.

Evaluation Details: Twice during the semester, students will need to make oral presentations of findings obtained first through a group research project and then through an individual research project. Each presentation is worth 20% of the final grade. In addition, students will regularly be evaluated on their contributions to discussion and problem-solving tasks assigned in class. This component is worth 10% of the final grade.

Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation  Attendance Policy Students must attend at least two-thirds of the sessions, or they will receive an ‘F' for their final grade.  Homework and Participation Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, collecting experimental data, and preparing presentations.

n.c: Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two tests during the semester: a Mid-term Discussion Test worth 20%, and an Internet Research and Source Acknowledgement Quiz worth 10%.

n.c: 第7回および第14回の授業時間中に試験を実施し,理解度の確認を行います(試験の解説も同時間内に行います).  なお、授業の進捗状況によって試験実施週が変更になることがあります.成績評価方法の詳細は備考欄を見て下さい.  ただし,理解度確認試験で45%以上の得点を獲得していることを合格(C評価以上)の条件とします.  (試験は概ね60~80%)  理解度確認試験はオンライン試験にて実施する予定です.理解度確認試験の出題は英語で行います.
毎回の授業において自身の理解度や授業の感想などをWaseda Moodle の各回授業のレビュー課題に入力してもらい,授業への積極性を評価します.  成績評価方法の詳細は備考欄を見て下さい.  (各回授業のレビュー課題提出は概ね10~15%)
単に授業に出席したことによる加点評価は行いません.  一方で欠席は回数に応じて減点を行います.  成績評価方法の詳細は備考欄を見て下さい.
各章の終了時に理解度の確認のため,Waseda Moodle を利用した小テストを実施します.  成績評価方法の詳細は備考欄を見て下さい.  (小テストは概ね10〜30%)

n.c: Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two discussion tests during the semester: one in the first half related to group projects and another in the second half related to individual projects. Each test is worth 10%.

Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete two written reports (each worth 15%) based on in-class discussions and presentations: one for the group project and another for the individual project.

Evaluation Details: Twice during the semester, students will need to make oral presentations of findings obtained first through a group research project and then through an individual research project. Each presentation is worth 20% of the final grade. In addition, students will regularly be evaluated on their contributions to discussion and problem-solving tasks assigned in class. This component is worth 10% of the final grade.

Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation  Attendance Policy Students must attend at least two-thirds of the sessions, or they will receive an ‘F' for their final grade.  Homework and Participation Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, collecting experimental data, and preparing presentations.

Assignments and Exercises
Attendance and Class Discussion

There will be two short writing exercises (30%) and one long paper assignment (40%). For the writing exercise, students will respond to an essay question provided by the instructor. For the paper assignment, students will write on a topic they have chosen in consultation with the instructor. The paper should apply the ideas encountered in this class to aspects of the contemporary world and evaluate the relevance of critical theory for the present era.
Students are required to write their weekly reflections and discussion question on Moodle. Active participation in clas discussion is also required.

n.c: ※例年は筆記試験を実施するが、今年度はオンライン講義が主体のため、レポートを評価対象とする。
レポート課題について、的確に情報を検索し、合理的かつ建設的な自分の見解をまとめること(堀江)。  イノベーション、産業政策や企業の戦略について、講義の内容の理解度を確認する為に、合理的かつ建設的な自分の見解を記述・図示等で表現すること。自分が調査した国際標準規格についての調査規格提案書として、パワーポイントファイルの作成提出が望ましい(戸叶)。
アンケートを実施する。  標準規格化提案書作成途中の進捗状況(.pptxファイル)を適宜提出する。  講義内容への積極的な質問や自分のコメントを歓迎し、評価に加味する。

p: 国際的な知財戦略・標準化戦略を考察していく課程で「産業政策論」と「デジタルコンテンツ論」を理解していく。

q: 基礎科目 選択必修

n.c: 春学期の中間と期末にレポート課題を出す。単位取得にはそれらの提出を必須とする。レポートの基本構成、理解するべき事柄や論理、参考文献の引用などについて、最低限押さえるべき項目を具体的に通達する。提出されたレポートがその項目を押さえていると判断された場合、単位取得を認める。これらの要求は、講義を真面目に受講すれば、余裕を持って応じられる程度のものである。単位取得条件が満たされた場合、レポート内容の理解の正確さ、考察の深さ、論理の精密さ、文献精読への取り組みをそれぞれ精査し、"評価"を総合的に判断する。  Students will be required to submit reports at the middle and the end of the semester. The minimal requirements for a credit will be clarified. A philomath will have no difficulty in satisfying them. The score associated with the credit will be determined based on the level of understanding, depth of consideration, preciseness of logic, and the scope of the investigation based on references.

n.c: 教場試験を実施する。評価基準は以下の通り。  ・授業の内容を理解して、適切な文章で説明できる。  ・シグナル伝達の実験内容を解釈できる。  ・シグナル伝達の知識を利用して、実験を計画できる。  中間試験、期末試験の両方を受験することが単位付与の必要条件である。  欠席の扱いは、「定期試験受験上の注意」に準拠する(https://www.waseda.jp/fsci/students/exam/)。
授業で話した内容をもとにした小課題への回答などで評価する。詳細は第一回の授業の時に説明する。

n.c: 中間試験と期末試験をおこない,両方の成績を考慮して判断する。  片方しか受験しなかった学生には,他方の試験の出来の如何にかかわらず,単位を付与しない。  また,片方の試験において,事実上試験を(勉強を)放棄したとみなされる答案が提出された場合も,上記に同等であるとみなし,単位を付与しない。  【2023注】原則として教場での試験をおこなう予定だが、教場試験のかわりに課題提出により理解度を確認する可能性がある。担当の各教員からの指示をのがさないように注意してください。
(注)レポート課題の有無については各講義の担当者の裁量による。

n.c: 以下の課題について、本文2,400文字以上のレポートにして、提出してください。    講義で扱った諸問題の中から、あなたが特に着目したものを一つ選択し、関連する情報を検索して把握したうえで、深く掘り下げて論じてください。一例を挙げると、知的財産法やそれに関する企業や大学・研究機関の活動の中で、現在生じている問題を取り上げ、論点をまとめた上で、それに関してあなた自身がどう考えるか、どのような制度改正が考えられるか、などを論述してください。  レポートに適切な題名をつけてください。また、何をテーマとしているのかを、レポートの冒頭で明確に示してください。    引用した部分については、出典となる文献(インターネット上の情報を含む)を必ず記載し、どの部分がどの文献からの引用なのかが明確にわかるように留意してください。既存の情報を整理するだけでなく、自分自身の見解を示してください。
講義への出席と、議論への参加。

n.c: Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two discussion tests during the semester: one in the first half related to group projects and another in the second half related to individual projects. Each test is worth 10%.

Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete two written reports (each worth 15%) based on in-class discussions and presentations: one for the group project and another for the individual project.

Evaluation Details: Twice during the semester, students will need to make oral presentations of findings obtained first through a group research project and then through an individual research project. Each presentation is worth 20% of the final grade. In addition, students will regularly be evaluated on their contributions to discussion and problem-solving tasks assigned in class. This component is worth 10% of the final grade.

Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation  Attendance Policy Students must attend at least two-thirds of the sessions, or they will receive an ‘F' for their final grade.  Homework and Participation Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class.
